body.p: -- Your Petitioner John Hill & his neighbors state that on the day of he as indicted in the Madison circuit court for Gaming & gave an obligation with John H. Land to appear in said case & did attend two days & the case was not called & he failed to attend on the 3rd day & the case was called & his recognizance forfeited & he was fined twenty dollars & since that a Judgment has been rendered against Your petitioner Hill & John H Land his surety for two hundred dollars & costs & an execution is in the sheriffs hands against the bodies of Hill & Land & Hill is unable to pay the same is a poor hard working man & has never got out of the way -- The twenty dollar fine paid by him is as much as he ought to suffer & they respectfully request the Govenor to remit the two hundred dollars or such part of it as he has power to do -- The Judgment for the two hundred dollars was rendered at September term 1860
